bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers.digi_template¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers.digi_template.hdfMap_digi_template(digi_group)¶

Bases: object

A template class for all digitizer mapping classes to inherit from.

Note

Any method that raises a NotImplementedError is intended to be overwritten by the inheriting class.

Parameters:digi_group (h5py.Group) – the digitizer HDF5 group
_adc_info(adc_name, config_group)¶

Builds information on how the adc was configured.

Should call on _find_adc_connections() to determine active connections to the adc.

Parameters:
  • adc_name (str) – name of analog-digital converter
  • config_group (h5py.Group) – instance of the digitizers configuration group
Returns:

a list of of tuples adc_info containing configuration information of the adc that looks like

 
adc_info = [
    (board
     [channel, ],
     {'bit': int, # bit resolutions
      'sample rate': (float, str), # str='MHz', 'GHZ', etc
      'sample average (hardware)': int, # `None` for none
      'shot average (software)': int    # `None` for none
      }), ]

where

  • board (int) = active board number
  • channel (list(int)) = list of active channels on baord
  • 'bit' = bit resolution of adc
  • 'sample rate' = 2-element tuple defining sample rate of the adc. First element is value and second is its units.
  • 'sample average (hardware)' = int for the number of
    sample averaged together and None for no averaging
  • 'shot average (software)' = int for the number of
    consecutive shots averaged together and None for no averaging
Raise:NotImplementedError
_build_data_configs()¶

Builds and binds the dictionary data_configs that contains information about how the digitizer was configured.

Should call on the following methods to build data_configs:

  • parse_config_name()
  • is_config_active()
  • _find_config_adc()
  • _adc_info()
Raise:NotImplementedError
_find_adc_connections(adc_name, config_group)¶

Finds the active connections (boards, channels, and extras) on the adc.

Parameters:
  • adc_name (str) – name of adc
  • config_group (h5py.Group) – digitizer configuration group
Returns:

list of active adc connections formatted in the same manner as the return of _adc_info()
Raise:

NotImplementedError

Determines the adc’s used in the digitizer configuration.

Parameters:config_group (h5py.Group) – the digitizer configuration group
Returns:list of used adc’s
Return type:list(str)
Raise:NotImplementedError
_predefined_adc¶
Returns:a list of all known/defined analog-digital converters (adc)
Return type:list(str)
Raise:NotImplementedError
construct_dataset_name(board, channel, config_name=None, adc=None, return_info=False)¶

Constructs the name of the dataset corresponding to the input arguments.

Parameters:
  • board (int) – board number
  • channel (int) – channel number
  • config_name (str) – name of configuration
  • adc (str) – name of adc
  • return_info (bool) – True/False to indicate if adc information should be returned
Returns:

for return_info=False, then dataset name… for return_info=True, then (dataset name, adc information)…adc information contains the adc name and the dict of adc_info constructed by _adc_info()
Return type:

str, dict
Raise:

NotImplementedError
data_configs = None¶

data_configs will contain all the mapping information for each configuration of the digitizer. If no configurations are found the data_configs will be an empty dict. Otherwise, the dict keys will be the configuration names and data_configs will be structured as:

data_configs[config_name] = {
    'active': True/False, # config is active or not
    'adc': ['adc_name', ], # list of active adc's
    'group name': '', # name of configuration group
    'group path': '', # absolute path to configuration group
    'adc_name': [(int, # board number
                  [int, ], # list of active channels
                  {'bit': int, # bit resolution
                   'sample rate': (float, 'unit'),
                   'shot average (software)': int,
                   'sample average (hardware)': int}), ]}

where there will be a corresponding adc_name key for each adc in data_configs[config_name]['adc'].

digi_group¶
Returns:HDF5 digitizer group
Return type:h5py.Group
info = None¶

Information dict of digitizer HDF5 Group

info = {
    'group name': str, # name of digitizer group
    'group path': str  # full path to digitizer group
}
static is_config_active(config_name, dataset_names)¶

Determines if config_name was used in collecting the digitizer data.

Parameters:
  • config_name (str) – the digitizer configuration name
  • dataset_names (list(str)) – list of HDF5 dataset names in the digitizer group
Returns:

True/False if the digitizer configuration config_name was used for collecting the digitizer data
Return type:

bool
static parse_config_name(name)¶

Will parse the passed group name and determine if the group is a digitizer configuration group.

Parameters:name (str) – name of proposed HDF5 digitizer configuration group
Returns:True/False if name is a configuration group, name of configuration
Return type:tuple(bool, str)

construct_dataset_name(board, channel, config_name=None, adc='SIS 3301', return_info=False, silent=False)¶

Returns the name of a HDF5 dataset based on its configuration name, board, and channel. Format follows:

‘config_name [brd:ch]’

Returns:
static is_config_active(config_name, dataset_names)¶

The naming of a dataset starts with the name of its corresponding configuration. This scans ‘dataset_names’ fo see if ‘config_name’ is used in the list of datasets.

Parameters:
  • config_name –
  • dataset_names –
Returns:
static parse_config_name(name)¶

Parses ‘name’ to see if it matches the naming scheme for a data configuration group. A group representing a data configuration has the scheme:

Configuration: config_name
Parameters:name –
Returns:
